text: {{Infobox writer | name = Patricia Cornwell | image = Patricia Cornwell in 2016.jpg | caption = Cornwell in 2016 | pseudonym = | birth_name = Patricia Carroll Daniels | birth_date = | birth_place = Miami, Florida, U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Novelist | period = 1990–present | nationality = American | genre = Crime fiction | spouse = Charles Cornwell (1980–1989) Staci Gruber (2006–present) | website = | imagesize = 200px | influenced = }} Patricia Cornwell (born Patricia Carroll Daniels; June 9, 1956) is an American crime writer. She is known for her best-selling novels about medical examiner Kay Scarpetta solving murders in Richmond, Virginia. Cornwell is also known for leading the new research into the Jack the Ripper killings. Her books have sold more than 100 million copies. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:Living people Category:Writers from Miami Category:American novelists Category:Researchers Category:Crime writers
title: Patricia Cornwell
